intro: Antitaxis longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved antitaxis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender stems and compound leaves that are often finely divided. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions of southern Europe and is often found in woodland habitats. Due to its delicate structure and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
